text: Der St端rmer was a weekly newspaper published from 1923 to 1945. It contained propaganda for the policies of the Nazi Party in Germany. It was styled like a tabloid. It printed obscene antisemitic material with the intent to make people hate Jews.Dennis E. Showalter (1982) Little Man What Now? Der St端rmer in the Weimer Republic. Hamden, Connecticut: Archon Book. This included racist caricatures, accusations of blood libel and sex crimes, and articles about why Jews are a problem.Claudia Koonz, The Nazi Conscience, p 228 H. H. Ben-Sasson, ed. (1976): A History of the Jewish People. (Harvard University Press, Cambridge). , p.875 The paper was published by Julius Streicher. It was first printed in Nuremberg on 20 April 1923.Holocaust Education and Archive Research Team. Holocaust Research Project. 21 October 2009. This was at a time when Adolf Hitler was trying to seize power and control over the government. Der St端rmer continued to be published until the end of World War II. After the war, Streicher was executed for authorising the publication of articles that demanded the extermination of the Jewish race. ==References== ==Other websites== Category:Newspapers published in Germany Category:1923 establishments in Germany Category:1945 disestablishments in Germany Category:Nazi Germany Category:Fascism
